TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit MessageHeaderException extends System.ServiceModel.ProtocolException

remarks.para: This exception is typically thrown when there are too many headers or headers are missing from the message. This can include infrastructure headers such as the Action and Reliable Message headers. This exception derives from , which in turn derives from . The class represents a class of recoverable errors that may be thrown during communication between endpoints and that robust indigo1 client and service applications are expected to handle. To prevent the more generic handler from catching the more specific , catch this exception prior to handling .

summary.para: The exception that is thrown when the expectations regarding headers of a SOAP message are not satisfied when the message is processed.

Docs.param: To be added.
To be added.

remarks.para: Use this constructor when you want to pass an error message and information about an inner exception up to the user. The content of the message parameter should be understandable to the intended users.

An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception can include a reference to the previous exception in the property. The property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if the property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified message and the inner exception that caused the exception.
